snippet: Disney’s “Frozen” took in $93 million over the holiday weekend, partly because its marketing strategy played down the princesses in the film, in order to attract more boys.
lead_paragraph: Disney’s “Frozen” took in $93 million over the holiday weekend, partly because its marketing strategy played down the princesses in the film, in order to attract more boys.
abstract: Disney film Frozen takes in $93 million over holiday weekend, partly because its marketing strategy played down princesses featured in movie in effort to attract more boys.

headline.seo: ‘Frozen,’ Disney’s New Fairy Tale, Is No. 2 at Box Office
headline.main: Boys Don’t Run Away From These Princesses
headline.print_headline: Boys Don’t Run Away From These Princesses
